title: Two women 'drug a tourist at a Florida casino before robbing his $15,000 Rolex and $1,000 cash'
text:
Two women befriended a tourist at a Florida casino before being seen on surveillance camera pouring something into his drink, and then allegedly stealing his Rolex worth $15,000 and $1,000 in cash.

The 'sweet-talking duo' allegedly met the victim at the Hard Rock Hotel Casino in Fort Lauderdale around 2 am on September 13, a spokeswoman for the Broward Sheriff's office told DailyMail.com.

In the video released by the sheriff's office, the women are seen at a poker table cozying up to the tourist - who was not identified and whose face was obscured in the footage.

Two women (pictured above) were caught on surveillance video meeting with an unidentified tourist at the Hard Rock Hotel Casino in Hollywood, Florida, on September 13. The tourist alleged later that the women drugged and robbed him

Video footage from the casino (pictured above) shows one of the women appear to pour an unknown substance into the tourist's drink

The women are later seen sitting with the tourist at the slot machines. One of the suspects, a black woman, aged between 35 and 45, and dressed in a leopard jumpsuit, speaks with the man while the other suspect, a white woman with blonde hair, is seen pouring a substance into the tourist's drink.

'Immediately after taking it, he said he felt drugged and had difficulty moving,' the sheriff's department stated in a report.

Shortly after they're seated at the slot machines, footage then shows both women holding the tourist up as they walked down a hall and exit the casino. They then jumped into a car that drove them to the Sleep Inn & Suites in Dania Beach, about six miles away.

The tourist told detectives he fell unconscious the moment he walked into the hotel room. When he woke up the next morning, he alleged that his gold and silver Rolex - worth $15,000 - was missing, along with $1,000 cash.

The tourist later told authorities that the immediately after taking the drink, 'he said he felt drugged and had difficulty moving,' according to a report about the incident from the Broward Sheriff's Office

Afterwards, the footage (pictured above) shows both women holding the tourist as they walked down a hall and exited the casino

The women and tourist jumped into a ride share car that drove them to the Sleep Inn & Suites in Dania Beach, about six miles away. The tourist reported to detectives that woke up the next morning at the hotel and found his gold and silver Rolex was missing, along with $1000 cash

The white suspect is said to have a tattoo on her upper left chest and is between 35 to 45 years old. She wore a black blouse and black pants. The black suspect is believed to be about the same age range.

Anyone with information that can help investigators is asked to contact Dania Beach Detective Taylor Powell at 954-518-0153.

Anonymous tips can be made to the Broward Crime Stoppers at 954-493-TIPS (8477) or online at browardcrimestoppers.org. Anonymous tips that lead to an arrest are eligible for a reward of up to $3000.
description: Authorities are searching for two women caught on video at a Florida casino who appear to befriend and later drug a tourist, who is then lead out to a car and taken to a hotel where he was robbed.
